Text:
Now, the Saint Selection Ceremony is finally coming
to a climax! From here on, we enter the final
evaluation!

Who will make it back to town first, navigating from
the snowfield and through the forest? Let the
Reindeer Race begin!
Reindeer Race... So, is it like horseback riding?

According to popular tales, Santa is said to ride on
a sleigh drawn by reindeer. This must have been
inspired by that.

But the reindeer we have lined up for you are far
from ordinary!

You will all be riding on these magical beast
reindeer!
Magical beasts?! Isn't that dangerous...?

No need to worry! While they are magical beasts, most
have been tamed to some extent...though there might
be a few wild ones in the mix.

You are free to pick any magical beast reindeer you
want, but it's first come, first serve! Alright...
Ready, Set, Go!
Hehe... Interesting.

While the other participants are rushing to choose
their reindeer...you're awfully relaxed, aren't you?
Yes, I'll take my time choosing.
...Oh? What's that...?
Graaarrrr!

Oh dear! One of the magical beast reindeer is
rejecting a participant! It's...the most ferocious
male, Merry Whip!

Merry Whip...? His name sounds cute, but his
appearance says otherwise...
Hmm. He seems quite fast.

Yes, but his training appears to have been a bit
inadequate.
Grrrrrr...!

It looks like, this time, Merry Whip has locked onto
Princess Iris and Miss Beatrix! What will happen?!
Okay, I've made up my mind. I'll ride this one.

...Wait, hold on. I was actually thinking about
choosing him.

How about this? Whoever manages to tame Merry Whip
first gets to ride him.
Heheh. Sounds good. Let's go with that.
Graaarrrr!

That said, taming him like this might be difficult.
In that case...
First, we'll need to establish dominance...won't we?

Yes. It's the law of nature—survival of the fittest.
We need to show him who's stronger.
Grarrr...?!

Whoa there! Merry Whip appears to be hesitating! Are
these two intimidating him?!
Graaarghhh!
You're set on resisting, huh...!

We should watch out for those antlers and his kicks.
A direct hit could force us to retreat.

You're right... We need to both be cautious while
confidently asserting our strength!
